timeline.title: QMC Inc. / Applied Tech Systems, LLC.
timeline.description:
Hired to assist with application and desktop support. Durig that time I learned a lot about the IT industry and how to support end users.
I was able to learn about the company's proprietary software products and eventually was responsible with the installation and support of the software
with customers like: Boeing, Rols Royce, Honda, Volkswagen, GM, and many others.

timeline.title: Oakland Community College
timeline.description:
I started at OCC in 2013. They were the Raiders at the time #RaiderNation, now they are the OCC Owls which is cool too.
I majored in Computer Inforamation Systems and took classes like: Java, C++, DataStructures & Algorithms, Web & Game Development, etc.

timeline.title: Worldwise.Net
timeline.description:
I was hired as a web developer at Worldwise.Net. I was responsible for the development and maintenance of the company's website and client websites.
I was able to learn a lot about web development and design during my time there. I was eventually setup and  managed our company's on-prem
domain server. I was then responsible for client server & network installations and support. I was also responsible for all email services and our
Amazon EC2 servers. I learned to work with CMS systems like WordPress, Joomla, and Drupal. I also learned to work with e-commerce platforms like
Magento and WooCommerce. Working as many roles I gained skills in: HTML, CSS, JavaScript/jQuery, PHP, MySQL, Linux, Windows Server, nginx, Git, Apache, Shopify, and more.

timeline.title: High Level Marketing, LLC
timeline.description:
I leave Worldwise.Net to join High Level Marketing. I was hired as a web developer and was responsible for the frontend development
and maintenance of the company's website and client websites. I was responsible for connecting the company's proprietary CMS to client websites as
well as developing custom themes and features for Google Tag Manager and Google Analytics. I created custom Google Maps for clients. I was
eventually asked to assist with a major refactoring task involving refactoring a 10k line php file, assisting with the upgrade of php 5.6 to php 7.0,
and implementing PDO. I worked more with build tools like Grunt, Gulp, and NPM Scripts.

timeline.title: Graduate from Oakland Community College
timeline.description: I graduated from OCC in 2018 with an Associate of Science Degree in Computer Information Systems focusing in Software Engineering.

timeline.title: United Shore Financial Services, LLC
timeline.description:
I was hired as a `UI Developer I` at United Shore. I was responsible for the development and maintenance of the company's websites as well as internal tools
primarily in the frontend including [UWM](uwm.com) & EASE (the broker portal). This was my first Agile environment and I was able to learn a lot about Agile and Scrum. I was able to work with a lot of
Business Partnership Teams (BPTs), and because not every team had a UI component in scope every sprint, I was able to participate with up to 10 teams
at one point. Eventually I was asked to assist with the development of the company's first [Vue SPA](https://brand360.uwm.com/). I was promoted to `UI Developer II` after
facilitating the advancement of colleagues in vue, vuex, vue-router, webpack, and ES6+.

timeline.title: Tyle Technologies
timeline.description:
I joined the team as a Software Engineer working on their records management system (RMS). It was a C# .NET application with a SQL Server backend
serving an Angular Hybrid (AngularJS & Angular) frontend via nginx. I was able to learn a lot about Public Safety Softare and the industry of selling
software to a market. This was an Agile environment as well.

timeline.title: United Wholesale Mortgage
timeline.description:
I was hired back to UWM as a `UI Developer II` to work on the Brand360 application. I then worked on the company's first large-scale React SPA
called `BOLT`. While Brand360 was a `custom marketing material` application, BOLT was a Broker & Unerwrither tool. I was able to work with
create-react-app, redux, redux-thunks, react-router, react-pdf, and pdf-lib.

timeline.title: Marry my Wife
timeline.description: We got married in Charlevoix, MI. It was a beautiful day and we were surrounded by family and friends.

timeline.title: First Son is Born
timeline.description: My wife and I welcomed our first son into the world in December, 2022. He is a happy and healther fella.

timeline.title: Promoted to `UI Architect
timeline.description:
In that year: I migrated BOLT from CRA & webpack to Vite & esbuild resulting in reduction in build and test times, reduced the application's npm package vulnerabilities to 0, implemented a
DSL and React library that allowed for a SDUI (Server Driven UI) approach to application development, myself and one other peer coordinated the adoption of said pattern
into the application, mentored 3 other UI Developers.
